abstract: Mortgage insurers are increasingly “un-selling” their policies in a bid to boost the bottom line. But in an opinion piece for DealBook, two attorneys from Anderson Kill & Olick say this amounts to rewriting history.
snippet: Mortgage insurers are increasingly “un-selling” their policies in a bid to boost the bottom line. But in an opinion piece for DealBook, two attorneys from Anderson Kill & Olick say this amounts to rewriting history.
lead_paragraph: Rhonda D. Orin, managing partner of the Washington office of Anderson Kill & Olick, and Pamela D. Hans, an attorney for the firm in Philadelphia, have noticed a trend of mortgage insurers “uninsuring” policyholders. They say it’s not a business solution for companies facing bad risks.

headline.main: Another View: Rewriting History in the Mortgage Crisis
